meanings.definition: Tumps (verb): to strike or hit with a heavy blow
meanings.sent1: He tumps the nail into the wood with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: She tumps the ball hard during the game.
meanings.sent3: The chef tumps the dough to make it flat for the pizza.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm tumps the trees with its fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith tumps the hot metal to shape it into a horseshoe.

meanings.definition: Tumps (noun): a mound or small hill
meanings.sent1: The children play on the tumps in the park.
meanings.sent2: The hikers climbed the tumps to get a better view.
meanings.sent3: The rabbits dig burrows under the tumps for shelter.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins are surrounded by tumps of earth.
meanings.sent5: The sheep graze peacefully on the green tumps.

meanings.definition: Tumps (adjective): having a rounded or humped shape
meanings.sent1: The tumps rocks lined the garden path.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar had a tumps body as it crawled.
meanings.sent3: The tumps clouds in the sky looked like fluffy pillows.
meanings.sent4: The old tree had a tumps trunk due to its age.
meanings.sent5: The bumpy road was full of tumps bumps that made the ride rough.
